decks.notes: This deck focuses on using cheap, efficient spells and creatures to quickly apply pressure to the opponent and win the game as fast as possible. By using cards like Lightning Bolt, Soul-Scar Mage, and Monastery Swiftspear, the goal is to deal damage quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Underworld Breach allows for additional recursion and flexibility in casting spells from the graveyard. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion to provide additional consistency and power to the deck.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Amulet Titan combo by using cards like Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and Urza's Saga to generate strong, ramped-up plays. The deck focuses on utilizing lands like Simic Growth Chamber and Gruul Turf to create multiple land drops in a turn, allowing for explosive plays and the ability to search for key combo pieces. By leveraging the synergy between these cards, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and set up powerful win conditions like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Kessig Wolf Run.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Architects of Will, Ardent Plea, and Misty Rainforest to cycle through your deck and set up your graveyard with creatures. Once you have a full graveyard, you can cast Living End to bring all your creatures back onto the battlefield, potentially overwhelming your opponent with a powerful board presence. Cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation help protect your combo pieces while you set up, and other creatures like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves provide additional value and disruption for your opponent.

Utilizing artifacts and efficient control spells, this deck focuses on assembling powerful artifact synergies with cards like Urza, Thopter Foundry, and Sword of the Meek. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for essential artifacts and generating tokens. With counterspells like Metallic Rebuke and disruptive cards like Esper Sentinel, this deck aims to control the game while generating value and eventually overwhelming the opponent with a combination of powerful artifacts. The inclusion of cards like Portable Hole and Pithing Needle also allows for additional disruption and interaction with the opponent's strategy.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam, Angel's Grace, and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. By utilizing cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to ramp mana, along with cantrips like Sleight of Hand and Preordain to dig for combo pieces, the deck can win as early as turn three. Phyrexian Unlife and Pact of Negation provide protection, while Spoils of the Vault acts as a tutor. The manabase includes various lands that can produce different colors of mana, helping to ensure the consistency of the combo.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to draw more cards and maintain tempo. The key goal is to apply constant pressure and finish the game as quickly as possible, with cards like Lightning Bolt and Dragon's Rage Channeler providing additional reach. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion, providing additional value and flexibility to the deck. The mana base is designed to support quick plays and ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the spells in the deck.
